conclusion: To predict which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the paths of the liquid streams from A, B, C, and D step by step.
The green liquid flows out from A.
The green liquid encounters the brown baffle, which directs the liquid downward and to the left.
The green liquid continues downward and enters container E.
The pink liquid flows out from B.
The pink liquid encounters the purple baffle, which directs the liquid downward and slightly to the right.
The pink liquid continues downward and enters container F.
The yellow liquid flows out from C.
The yellow liquid encounters the orange baffle, which directs the liquid downward and slightly to the right.
The yellow liquid continues downward and enters container F.
The blue liquid flows out from D.
The blue liquid encounters the blue baffle, which directs the liquid downward and to the right.
The blue liquid continues downward and enters container G.
Container E receives liquid from A (green).
Container F receives liquid from B (pink) and C (yellow).
Container G receives liquid from D (blue).
